Description: Pottery lamp. Applied vertical band-handle. Top decorated with frog. Shoulder shows animals with plants in their mouths (lions and hounds, possibly hares), and palmettes. Nozzle-top decorated with hare. Undefined base. Pink clay, with mica covered with an orange-red slip.
Curator's comments: Close: Bisson de la Roque, F., 1933. ‘Rapport sur les fouilles de Médamoud (1931 et 1932)’. Cairo : Institut français d'archéologie orientale, p. 84, fig. 52; 'Staatliche Museen zy Berlin, Forschungen und Berichte' iii-iv, 1961, p. 63, figs 5-7. Near: Bernhard, M.L., 1955. ‘Lampki starożytne’. Warsaw : Wydawnictwo sztuka, 550, from Edfu; Michalowski, K., 1938. ‘Tell Edfou 1938’. Cairo : L'Institut français d'archéologie orientale, pl. xxxiii, 11; ‘Jahrbuch für Antike und Christentum’ xi-xii, 1968-9, pl. 14b, from Edfu; Gayet, A.J., 1902. ‘L'art copte : école d'Alexandrie, architecture monastique, sculpture, peinture, art somptuaire’. Paris : E. Leroux, p. 93; 'Bullettino di Archeologia Cristiana, Series 3', iv, 1879, pl. III, inscribed 'The Cross is the prop', said to be from Alexandria.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (2219)
Acquisition name: Purchased through: Sir Ernest A T Wallis Budge
